modules.description: Provides functions to create, blend, and convert color values between RGB, HSL, and HEX representations. Operates on tuples and records that encode color components with precise numerical ranges. Used to generate color gradients and apply tinting effects in graphical user interfaces.

Provides functions to create, compare, and manipulate time ranges defined by start and end timestamps. Works with a custom type representing a pair of datetime values. Used to validate overlapping intervals and calculate duration between specified time spans.

Provides functions to create and manipulate fill patterns for plots, including solid color fills and predefined Gnuplot hatching styles. Operates on a type representing fill configurations, including color and pattern parameters. Used to customize the visual appearance of graph areas in output plots.

Creates an output object configured with specific rendering backend, font, size, and additional parameters. Works with types such as strings, tuples for size, and variant types representing different output formats. Used to generate graphical outputs like PNGs, EPS, or X11 windows with custom styling.

Creates a label structure with optional x and y string values, initialized to a default state. Works with the abstract type t to represent labeled entities. Used to generate and manage label instances in UI components or data tagging systems.

The module offers functions to generate data series for diverse visualizations, including line, point, step, histogram, and candlestick charts, handling numerical, time-stamped, and date-based data. It works with structures like Y-value lists, X-Y pairs, OHLC tuples, and timezone-aware time data, enabling customization through parameters like titles and colors. Specific use cases include financial data analysis with candlestick charts using OHLC tuples and time-series plotting with timezone-sensitive or date-based inputs.

Provides functions to generate and customize 2D plots, including setting titles, labels, and data ranges. Works with lists of points and ranges for plotting functions and data files. Used to visualize mathematical functions and experimental data directly from OCaml code.

Encapsulates tools for generating and customizing graphical outputs by combining color manipulation, time range handling, fill patterns, output configuration, labeling, and data series generation. It supports operations on color tuples, time intervals, fill configurations, output parameters, label structures, and data sets, enabling tasks like creating gradient-filled plots, defining time-based visualizations, and generating labeled charts. Functions allow for blending colors, validating time overlaps, applying hatch patterns, setting output formats, adding labels, and plotting financial or time-series data. Examples include generating candlestick charts with OHLC data, configuring plot fills with HSL colors, and exporting visualizations in PNG or EPS formats.
